org.eclipse.keyple.calypso.transaction

Class PoTransaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.keyple.calypso.transaction.PoTransaction

  • public final class PoTransaction
extends java.lang.Object
    Portable Object Secure Session. A non-encrypted secure session with a Calypso PO requires the management of two ProxyReader in order to communicate with both a Calypso PO and a SAM

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PoTransaction.ModificationMode
      The modification mode indicates whether the secure session can be closed and reopened to manage the limitation of the PO buffer memory.
      static class  PoTransaction.SamSettings
      List of SAM settings keys that can be provided when the secure session is created.
      static class  PoTransaction.SessionAccessLevel
      The PO Transaction Access Level: personalization, loading or debiting.
      static class  PoTransaction.SessionState
      The PO Transaction State defined with the elements: ‘IOError’, ‘SEInserted’ and ‘SERemoval’.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PoTransaction

        public PoTransaction(org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.SeReader poReader,
                     CalypsoPo calypsoPO,
                     org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.SeReader samReader,
                     java.util.EnumMap<PoTransaction.SamSettings,java.lang.Byte> samSetting)
        PoTransaction with PO and SAM readers.
        • Logical channels with PO & SAM could already be established or not.
        • A list of SAM parameters is provided as en EnumMap.
        Parameters:
        poReader - the PO reader
        calypsoPO - the CalypsoPo object obtained at the end of the selection step
        samReader - the SAM reader
        samSetting - a list of SAM related parameters. In the case this parameter is null, default parameters are applied. The available setting keys are defined in PoTransaction.SamSettings

      • PoTransaction

                     CalypsoPo calypsoPO)
        PoTransaction with PO reader and without SAM reader.
        • Logical channels with PO could already be established or not.
        Parameters:
        poReader - the PO reader
        calypsoPO - the CalypsoPo object obtained at the end of the selection step

      • setAuthorizedKvcList

        public void setAuthorizedKvcList(java.util.List<java.lang.Byte> authorizedKvcList)
        Provides a list of authorized KVC If this method is not called, the list will remain empty and all KVCs will be accepted. If a list is provided and a PO with a KVC not belonging to this list is presented, a KeypleCalypsoSecureSessionUnauthorizedKvcException will be raised.
        Parameters:
        authorizedKvcList - the list of authorized KVCs

        public org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.message.SeResponse processSamCommands(java.util.List<SamSendableInSession> samCommands)
                                                                 throws org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.KeypleReaderException
        Process SAM commands.
        • On the SAM reader, transmission of a SeRequest with channelState set to KEEP_OPEN.
        • Returns the corresponding SAM SeResponse.
        Parameters:
        samCommands - a list of commands to sent to the SAM
        Returns:
        SeResponse all sam responses
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.KeypleReaderException - if a reader error occurs

      • processOpening

        public boolean processOpening(PoTransaction.ModificationMode modificationMode,
                              PoTransaction.SessionAccessLevel accessLevel,
                              byte openingSfiToSelect,
                              byte openingRecordNumberToRead)
                       throws org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.KeypleReaderException
        Open a Secure Session.
        • The PO must have been previously selected, so a logical channel with the PO application must be already active.
        • The PO serial & revision are identified from FCI data.
        • A first request is sent to the SAM session reader.
          • In case not logical channel is active with the SAM, a channel is open.
          • Then a Select Diversifier (with the PO serial) & a Get Challenge are automatically operated. The SAM challenge is recovered.
        • The PO Open Session command is built according to the PO revision, the SAM challenge, the keyIndex, and openingSfiToSelect / openingRecordNumberToRead.
        • Next the PO reader is requested:
          • for the currently selected PO, with channelState set to KEEP_OPEN,
          • and some PO Apdu Requests including at least the Open Session command and all prepared PO command to operate inside the session.
        • The session PO keyset reference is identified from the PO Open Session response, the PO challenge is recovered too.
        • According to the PO responses of Open Session and the PO commands sent inside the session, a "cache" of SAM commands is filled with the corresponding Digest Init & Digest Update commands.
        • All parsers returned by the prepare command methods are updated with the Apdu responses from the PO.
        Parameters:
        modificationMode - the modification mode: ATOMIC or MULTIPLE (see PoTransaction.ModificationMode)
        accessLevel - access level of the session (personalization, load or debit).
        openingSfiToSelect - SFI of the file to select (0 means no file to select)
        openingRecordNumberToRead - number of the record to read
        Returns:
        true if all commands are successful
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.KeypleReaderException - the IO reader exception

      • processPoCommands

        public boolean processPoCommands(org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.ChannelState channelState)
                          throws org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.KeypleReaderException
        Process all prepared PO commands in a Secure Session.
        • On the PO reader, generates a SeRequest for the current selected AID, with channelState set to KEEP_OPEN, and ApduRequests with the PO commands.
        • In case the secure session is active, the "cache" of SAM commands is completed with the corresponding Digest Update commands.
        • All parsers returned by the prepare command methods are updated with the Apdu responses from the PO.
        Parameters:
        channelState - indicates if the SE channel of the PO reader must be closed after the last command
        Returns:
        true if all commands are successful
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.KeypleReaderException - IO Reader exception

      • processClosing

        public boolean processClosing(org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.protocol.TransmissionMode transmissionMode,
                              org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.ChannelState channelState)
                       throws org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.KeypleReaderException
        Sends the currently prepared commands list (may be empty) and closes the Secure Session.
        • The ratification is handled according to the communication mode.
        • The logical channel can be left open or closed.
        • All parsers returned by the prepare command methods are updated with the Apdu responses from the PO.
        Parameters:
        transmissionMode - the communication mode. If the communication mode is CONTACTLESS, a ratification command will be generated and sent to the PO after the Close Session command; the ratification will not be requested in the Close Session command. On the contrary, if the communication mode is CONTACTS, no ratification command will be sent to the PO and ratification will be requested in the Close Session command
        channelState - indicates if the SE channel of the PO reader must be closed after the last command
        Returns:
        true if all commands are successful
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.KeypleReaderException - the IO reader exception This method is deprecated.
        • The argument of the ratification command is replaced by an indication of the PO communication mode.

      • prepareReadRecordsCmd

        public ReadRecordsRespPars prepareReadRecordsCmd(byte sfi,
                                                 ReadDataStructure readDataStructureEnum,
                                                 byte firstRecordNumber,
                                                 int expectedLength,
                                                 java.lang.String extraInfo)
        Builds a ReadRecords command and add it to the list of commands to be sent with the next process command.

        The expected length is provided and its value is checked between 1 and 250.

        Returns the associated response parser.

        Parameters:
        sfi - the sfi top select
        readDataStructureEnum - read mode enum to indicate a SINGLE, MULTIPLE or COUNTER read
        firstRecordNumber - the record number to read (or first record to read in case of several records)
        expectedLength - the expected length of the record(s)
        extraInfo - extra information included in the logs (can be null or empty)
        Returns:
        ReadRecordsRespPars the ReadRecords command response parser
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if record number < 1
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if the request is inconsistent

      • prepareReadRecordsCmd

        public ReadRecordsRespPars prepareReadRecordsCmd(byte sfi,
                                                 ReadDataStructure readDataStructureEnum,
                                                 byte firstRecordNumber,
                                                 java.lang.String extraInfo)
        Builds a ReadRecords command and add it to the list of commands to be sent with the next process command. No expected length is specified, the record output length is handled automatically.

        Returns the associated response parser.

        Parameters:
        sfi - the sfi top select
        readDataStructureEnum - read mode enum to indicate a SINGLE, MULTIPLE or COUNTER read
        firstRecordNumber - the record number to read (or first record to read in case of several records)
        extraInfo - extra information included in the logs (can be null or empty)
        Returns:
        ReadRecordsRespPars the ReadRecords command response parser
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if record number < 1
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if the request is inconsistent

      • prepareAppendRecordCmd

        public AppendRecordRespPars prepareAppendRecordCmd(byte sfi,
                                                   byte[] newRecordData,
                                                   java.lang.String extraInfo)
        Builds an AppendRecord command and add it to the list of commands to be sent with the next process command.

        Returns the associated response parser.

        Parameters:
        sfi - the sfi to select
        newRecordData - the new record data to write
        extraInfo - extra information included in the logs (can be null or empty)
        Returns:
        AppendRecordRespPars the AppendRecord command response parser
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if the command is inconsistent

                                                   java.lang.String extraInfo)
        Builds an UpdateRecord command and add it to the list of commands to be sent with the next process command

        Returns the associated response parser.

        Parameters:

        recordNumber - the record number to update
        newRecordData - the new record data to write
        extraInfo - extra information included in the logs (can be null or empty)
        Returns:
        UpdateRecordRespPars the UpdateRecord command response parser
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if record number is < 1
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if the request is inconsistent

      • prepareIncreaseCmd

        public IncreaseRespPars prepareIncreaseCmd(byte sfi,
                                           byte counterNumber,
                                           int incValue,
                                           java.lang.String extraInfo)
        Builds a Increase command and add it to the list of commands to be sent with the next process command

        Returns the associated response parser.

        Parameters:
        counterNumber - >= 01h: Counters file, number of the counter. 00h: Simulated Counter file.
        sfi - SFI of the file to select or 00h for current EF
        incValue - Value to add to the counter (defined as a positive int <= 16777215 [FFFFFFh])
        extraInfo - extra information included in the logs (can be null or empty)
        Returns:
        IncreaseRespPars the Increase command response parser
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if the decrement value is out of range
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if the command is inconsistent

      • prepareDecreaseCmd

        public DecreaseRespPars prepareDecreaseCmd(byte sfi,
                                           byte counterNumber,
                                           int decValue,
                                           java.lang.String extraInfo)
        Builds a Decrease command and add it to the list of commands to be sent with the next process command

        Returns the associated response parser.

        Parameters:
        counterNumber - >= 01h: Counters file, number of the counter. 00h: Simulated Counter file.
        sfi - SFI of the file to select or 00h for current EF
        decValue - Value to subtract to the counter (defined as a positive int <= 16777215 [FFFFFFh])
        extraInfo - extra information included in the logs (can be null or empty)
        Returns:
        DecreaseRespPars the Decrease command response parser
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if the decrement value is out of range
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if the command is inconsistent
